TITLE: Biden, Xi Meet as Countries Move Toward Reopening Communication
SUMMARY: President Biden and Chinese leader Xi Jinping began a closely watched meeting that officials on both sides said was intended to repair ruptured lines of communication between the two powers.

TITLE: JPMorgan Dodges a Buyout-Loan Bullet
SUMMARY: The bank avoided loans backing purchases of companies such as Twitter and Citrix, which hurt Bank of America and other competitors after markets hit turbulence.

TITLE: FTX Investigating a Potential Hack Amid Bankruptcy
SUMMARY: More than $370 million worth of crypto funds appears to be missing, according to a crypto analytics firm.

TITLE: Elon Musk, Tesla Board Members to Defend CEO's Pay in Court
SUMMARY: Elon Musk is headed to court this week in Delaware to defend his multibillion-dollar compensation package at Tesla.

TITLE: Wanted: Paralegal. Starting Pay: Depends on Which New York Firm.
SUMMARY: Now job seekers can discover that a litigation paralegal at one law firm will earn a base salary of $55,000, while someone hired for the same title at other firms can earn at least $70,000. But it isn’t always apples to apples.

TITLE: 'Black Panther' Sequel Earns $180 Million in Domestic Open, Bolstering Disney
SUMMARY: “Black Panther: Wakanda Forever” set a record in ticket sales for a November open, underscoring Disney’s Marvel Studios’ continued dominance at the box office.

TITLE: G-20 Discord Likely to Thwart Efforts to Boost Sagging Global Economy
SUMMARY: War in Ukraine, inflation and U.S.-China tensions are all dividing major economies and making any coordinated response difficult.

TITLE: Some Russia Sanctions Could Extend Beyond War's End, Yellen Says
SUMMARY: The U.S. Treasury secretary says any eventual peace agreement between Russia and Ukraine would involve a review of the penalties the U.S. and its allies have imposed on Moscow’s economy.

TITLE: Labor Market Mystery: Where Are the Older Gen Z Workers?
SUMMARY: There are half a million fewer workers in their early 20s working or actively seeking a job now versus before the pandemic, and economists want to know why.

TITLE: China Dials Back Property Restrictions in Bid to Reverse Economic Slide
SUMMARY: Partial easing of housing-sector rules comes as Beijing also seeks to lessen economic toll of strict Covid controls.

TITLE: As Pandemic Aid Dries Up, Businesses Chase Covid Tax Credit
SUMMARY: The hottest business tax break is the employee retention credit, a pandemic-aid provision that expired more than a year ago.

TITLE: Inflation, Supply-Chain Woes Hit Medical-Device Makers
SUMMARY: Across the industry, certain semiconductors and specialized plastics, metals and resins are hard to come by.

TITLE: Newman's Own Foundation CEO Plans to Leave Amid Family Fight
SUMMARY: The foundation says it is “well along” in the search for a successor amid a lawsuit by two of Paul Newman’s daughters.

TITLE: Macau Under Spotlight Amid U.S. Inspections of China-Based Audits
SUMMARY: Investors are seeking greater disclosure on public companies’ exposure to uninspected audit work in the financial statements, at a time when a recent agreement allowing U.S. accounting regulators to inspect China-based audits is raising questions about unregistered auditors’ role.

TITLE: Coming Soon for Homeowners: Solar Panels That Actually Look Attractive
SUMMARY: Among the possibilities are solar cells that can be sprayed on like paint.

TITLE: China's Global Port Investments Give Rise to Security Worries
SUMMARY: The expanding network could make it easier for Beijing to service a Chinese navy that has become one of Washington’s biggest military concerns, analysts say.
